title: Week 1: Introduction to AI: History & Definitions
description: An overview of the history and fundamental definitions of Artificial Intelligence, setting the stage for understanding its evolution and impact.

title: Week 2: Core Concepts of AI: Machine Learning
description: Explores the core concepts of machine learning, including algorithms and their application. Students will participate in hands-on workshops to deepen their understanding.

title: Week 3: Natural Language Processing
description: Delves into the field of natural language processing (NLP), focusing on the techniques used to process and analyze human language data through lectures and group projects.

title: Week 4: Robotics and Perception
description: Focuses on the interplay between robotics and perception, utilizing hands-on lab sessions to apply theoretical knowledge to practical tasks.

title: Week 5: AI Applications across Industries
description: Discusses various case studies highlighting the application of AI technologies in different industries, encouraging discussion and analysis.

title: Week 6: Ethical Considerations in AI
description: Engages students in debates on the ethical implications and societal impacts of AI, supported by selected readings that provoke critical thinking.

title: Week 7: Practical Session: AI Tools and Programming
description: Provides hands-on experience with AI tools and programming languages, giving students the opportunity to apply their skills in real-world situations.

title: Week 8: Data Integrity and Algorithmic Bias
description: Investigates issues related to data integrity and algorithmic bias, encouraging students to critically evaluate case studies and the implications of these issues.

title: Week 9: Collaboration in AI: Project Development
description: Focuses on team-based project work and peer reviews, fostering collaboration among students while researching online articles related to AI project development.

title: Week 10: Preparing for the Job Market in AI
description: Involves networking events with industry professionals and activities focused on career development to prepare students for entering the job market.

title: Week 11: Presentations of Final Projects
description: Students present their final projects, showcasing their learning and application of AI concepts throughout the course.

title: Week 12: Course Wrap-up: Future of AI
description: Concludes the course with discussions about the future of AI, providing feedback and reflections on the learning journey.
